intro: Thesium ramosum var. longebracteatum, commonly known as the long-bract thesium, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Xanthophyllaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and dense, branched stems. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, often accompanied by distinctive bracts. Its leaves are typically linear and arranged in a spiral pattern along the stem. This species is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient plant in harsh climates.
